intro: Phyllanthus gilletii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to sub-Saharan Africa and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive waxy coating, while its fruit is a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds. Phyllanthus gilletii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions.
